phrasetype.name: glowhostspamomatic
phrasetype.phrase: GlowHost - Spam-O-Matic
Enter a list of group IDs, separated by commas. Members of these groups will be protected from potential actions of this tool - i.e. this tool can not be used against these users.
Spam-O-Matic: Protect Groups
Enter a list of userids, separated by commas, who will be protected against the use of this tool (see option above).
Spam-O-Matic: Protect Users
Exclude IPs

Always exclude these IP numbers from testing

In this format
123.123.10 (will ban 123.123.10.*) or 123.123.123.10 for a single IP number
Put a space required between IP numbers
Exclude email addresses

Always exclude these email addresses from testing

In this format
*@gooddomain.com
Put a space between each email addresses (case insensitive)
Exclude user names

Always exclude these user names from testing

Space required between names (case insensitive)
Names with a space in them must be in quotes - eg "Good User"
StopForumSpam: API Key

Your StopForumSpam API Key:

This key is not required, but we suggest obtaining one. If you obtain a key and save it here, any spammers that are able to sneak by the automated checks and post on your forum, can be automatically submitted to the StopForumSpam database.

To auto-submit spammers to the StopForumSpam database, simply moderate a post and select the option from the Moderation Tools menu for the Punitive action: "Ban users" and select the option to "Delete Posts As Spam..."

To obtain your free StopForumSpam Key, visit StopForumSpam.com
StopForumSpam: IP Check
Test the IP address against the StopForumSpam database
StopForumSpam: Username Check
Test username against the StopForumSpam database
StopForumSpam: Email Check
Test the email address against the ban list
StopForumSpam: Desired Action
What should happen if the new registration is listed in the StopForumSpam database
StopForumSpam: Query Connection Errors

What should happen if the remote connection times out when querying the new registration?

* Note: Only applies if set to block listed registrations in the above setting
StopForumSpam: Data Fetching - Cache
Duration in minutes that remote queries should be cached to reduce query traffic / lookup duration and load on the remote server
StopForumSpam: Remote Expiry

Remote query expiry age in days
www.StopForumSpam.com lists IP/usernames/email addresses that date back some time (in some cases, several months). This option will expire old records when doing queries.

Small expiry could result in persistent spammers being able to register and a high expiry age could result in innocent people being denied registration is they happen to get an IP number that a spammer used a while ago
StopForumSpam: Auto-submit from Easy Cleanup

Auto-submit user details to StopForumSpam.com if Easy Cleanup used.

* Requires StopForumSpam API Key
Auto-Moderation: Enable
Set this to "Disabled" to completely disable all Auto-Moderation settings below.
Auto-Moderation: Bad Words

If any of these keywords (one word per line) appears in a new thread or reply, it will automatically be placed under Moderation regardless of user postcount.

Enter Keywords in lowercase only. To see more example bad words, click here.
Auto-Moderation: URL Count

The maximum number of URLs a user can post in a new thread or reply.

If the number of URLs posted is more than the defined value here, the post will be automatically placed under Moderation. For example:

If the setting is 0, the user can't post any URLs. If they do, they will be automatically moderated.
If the setting is 1, the user can post up to 1 URL before being moderated.
If the setting is 2, the user can post up to 2 URLs before being moderated, etc.
Any posts found to exceed the defined limit will be sent to moderation.
Auto-Moderation: Minimum Post Count

Minimum postcount required to avoid keyword and URL moderation. If user has a higher postcount than this number, their post will never be auto-moderated. To always scan all posts from all users, set this value to 0. This does not effect moderators and admins.
Auto-Moderation: Post Action
Choosing to Moderate Post will make it possible to publish the post at a later date after reviewing its contents. Preventing Post won't allow the user to make the post.
Set this to Disabled to avoid user posts being checked using Akismet service.
Akismet: Enable

This setting controls how many of a user's posts will be scanned by the Akismet Service. Once a user's post count exceeds this threshold, their posts will not be scanned for spam content. To always scan all posts from all users, set this value to 0.
Akismet: Post Count

Your Akismet API Key:

The Akismet API Key is not required for your GlowHost Spam-O-Matic to function, but we suggest obtaining one. If you obtain a key and save it here, any spammers that are able to sneak by the automated checks and post on your forum, can be automatically submitted to the Akismet database. Additionally, posts by new users will be checked against the Akismet service. Suspeicious posts will be placed automatically in moderation.

If you do not obtain an Akismet API key, The auto-moderation functions below will still work.

To auto-submit spammers to the Akismet database, simply moderate a post and select the option from the Moderation Tools menu for the Punitive action: "Ban users" and select the option to "Delete Posts As Spam..."

Akismet has free and licensed keys available depending on your situation. To obtain a key for your forum, visit Akismet.com and choose the most appropriate option.
Akismet: API Key
Akismet: Auto-submit from Easy Cleanup

Auto-submit user details to Akismet if "Spam-O-Matic" is chosen from the Moderation Tools menu.

* Requires Akismet API Key.

You can disable all "Easy Cleanup" functions by setting this option to "Disabled." Your forums will still continue to block spammers and you can remove posts and other items using the built-in vBulletin moderation tools.
Easy Cleanup: Enable

If you choose to remove user, its profile, threads, posts, PMs and Calendar Events will be removed. If you choose to ban a user, you can configure the default values for your ban preferences on the Spam-O-Matic Forum Post Moderation Wizard below. These options can be overridden, or made static depending on how much control you want to give to your moderators who are in charge of spam cleanup.
Easy Cleanup: User Action
Your "Banned" usergroup ID number
Easy Cleanup: Banned UserGroup ID
Should threads started by the user be deleted?
Easy Cleanup: Remove Threads
Should posts made by the user be deleted?
Easy Cleanup: Remove Posts
Should any PMs sent by this user be deleted?
Easy Cleanup: Remove PMs
Should any calendar events started by this user be deleted?
Easy Cleanup: Remove Calendar Event
Should posts or threads be permanently deleted? Setting this option to "no" will soft delete.
Easy Cleanup: Permanent Thread/Post Delete
Give possibility for moderators to override these settings when removing a user.
Easy Cleanup: Allow Override
Newbies Manager: Put New User Into Newbies Group?
New users will be moved to Newbies group until their post count higher than defined here. For more information about the Newbies Manager, click here.
Newbies Manager: Newbies Group ID
The group ID that new users will be put into immediately after successfully registering.
Newbies Manager: Auto-promote Users From Newbies To Trusted/Registered Users?
Users will remain in the Newbies group forever unless you manually move them to another group. Set this to "Yes" to automatically promote them based on the settings below.
Newbies Manager: Trusted/Registered Users Group ID
A group ID that users are moved to upon reaching defined post-count. If you have a trusted group other than "Registered Users" Enter the Group ID here. (Default: 2)
Newbies Manager: Promotion From Post Count
Users are automatically moved to Trusted/Registered Users from Newbies group when they have more posts than set here.
Auto-Moderation: Apply Auto-Moderation To Newbies only?
Setting this to Yes will restrict Auto-Moderation to Newbies group users only.
Statistics: Display Number Of Denied Registrations?
Show the number of spammers who were denied registration in forum statistics.
Statistics: Display Number Of Banned Spammers?
Show the number of spammers who were banned and/or submitted to StopForumSpam and/or Akismet in forum statistics.
Statistics: Display Number Of User Details submitted to StopForumSpam?
Show the number of spammers whos details were submitted to StopForumSpam in forum statistics.
Statistics: Display Number Of Post Details submitted to Akismet?
Show the number of spammy posts that where submitted to Akismet in forum statistics.
Statistics: Display Number Of Automoderated Posts?
Show the number of posts put under moderation by Auto-Moderation tools.
Statistics: Display Number Of Removed Posts?
Show the number of posts that where removed with Easy-Cleanup.
Statistics: Link to Spam-O-Matic?
Link "By Spam-O-Matic" in forum statistics to vBulletin.org so others can protect their forums with Spam-O-Matic.
Affiliate System: Enable

Link to GlowHost.com and earn $125 per signup?
Click Here For Program Details

Enabling this will add a link to in the footer of your forum.
Affiliate System: Affiliate ID
Enter your ShareASale affiliate Id to earn credit for your referrals.
Affiliate System: Link position
If you have vBulletin copyright removed on your forums, select "Footer Links" to place affiliate link on the bottom of your forum pages.
Affiliate System: Link text
Affiliate link text.
Credits: Give Thanks

If you are unable to donate for this mod, you can show your thanks in other ways. We would very much appreciate setting this to "Yes" to help support development of this mod.

Setting this to Yes will add a small link to our site on your forum based on where you choose to display it below.
Credits: Thanks Location
Where do you want to display your link to GlowHost if "Give Thanks" setting above is enabled?
